intro: Aragallus veganus, commonly known as the vegan orchid, is a rare flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Andes. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, elongated leaves and intricate, fragrant blossoms. The plant thrives in cool, moist environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Its flowers are typically pale green or white, with a subtle fragrance that attracts specific pollinators. Due to its rarity and habitat specificity, Aragallus veganus is considered a conservation concern.
